* Cleanup build warnings

Co-authored-by: Mattias Reichel <mattias.reichel@gmail.com>

feat!: Update to Spring 6, Boot 3 (#13545)

* feat(spring6)!: Move from javax.servlet to jakarta.servlet
* chore: Update license headers
* fix(spring6): Simplify BeanCreationProfilingPostProcessor
- Remove overridden methods that has the same behavior as the default implementations.
- `postProcessPropertyValues()` is removed in Spring 6 and replaced with `postProcessProperties()` but this is now removed.
- Add @Nullable and @NonNull method parameter annotations to remove warning in Intellij.
* fix(spring6): Remove deprecated OptimizedAutowireCapableBeanFactory

This class is deprecated and uses API removed in Spring 6 -
`AbstractBeanFactory.getAccessControlContext()`

It also uses deprecated API in Java 17 - `java.lang.AccessController`
and `java.lang.SecurityManager`

* fix(spring6): Remove grails-web-fileupload project

The Spring CommonsMultipartResolver is removed in Spring 6.

The grails-web-fileupload project seems to have been created to address
a specific problem with the Safari browser. Hopefully this is resolved now
and this fix no longer necessary.

* fix(spring6): Deprecate MockHttpServletResponse

The overridden methods in this class has been removed in Spring 6.
This class does not serve a purpose any longer and is therefore deprecated.

* fix(spring6): Replace removed NestedIOException

NestedIOException has been removed in Spring 6.
IOException should be used directly instead.

* fix(spring6): Add missing classes for annotation reading

The class hierarchy for AnnotationMetadataReadingVisitor has been
removed in Spring 6 with no public replacement. This commit adds
them to the grails-core project instead as a workaround until
another solution is found.

* fix(spring6): Config loads correctly to Spring profiles

Spring has introduced a new `spring.config.activate.on-profile` config
property to signal if a config document should be included or not.

This commit refactors the existing `shouldSkipBlock` method to take
that into consideration. However, the usage of `shouldSkipBlock` was
removed in commit 03bef04. I'm not sure if that was an oversight, but
I have added the usage of this method back (now named `springProfileExclude`).

* test: Set `@PendingFeature` on tests that uses `grails-plugin-converters`

`grails-plugin-converters` has not yet been converted to jakarta.servlet.
This commit makes the test suite pass until that is fixed.

`GrailsMockHttpServletRequestTests` had to be converted from JUnit to Spock to be able to use `@PendingFeature`.

* test: Disable tests using `grails-gsp`

The `grails-gsp` module has not yet been converted to jakarta.servlet,
causing test failures. To ensure the test suite passes until this
conversion is complete, this commit disables the affected tests using
`@Ignore` (Spock) and `@Disabled` (JUnit5).

As the problem with the tests occurs in the initialization phase,
it was regrettably not possible to use `@PendingFeature`.

* test: Change Spring profile property in test config

Use the new `spring.config.activate.on-profile` config property
instead of the old `spring.profiles`.

* fix(deps): Update Spring to 6.0.22

* fix(deps): Update Tomcat to 10.1.25

* fix(deps): Update Spring Boot to 3.1.12

* feat!: Update to and compatible with Spring 6.1, Boot 3.2

* test(deps): Remove unused test dependencies

* feat!(deps): Update to and compatible with Micronaut 4.5

As Micronaut 4 does no longer include `jackson-databind` as a transitive
dependency, it is added as a direct dependency where ObjectMapper is used.

* chore(deps): Remove unused test dependencies

* docs: Add javadoc explaining that classes are ported from Spring

Add dev mode feature for recording models for existing GSP pages

- this feature makes it convenient to migrate to use compile static GSPs
- usage:
  - make sure you commit any changes to vcs (git) before using the
    feature since the feature modifies GSP files directly
  - activate with '-Dgrails.views.gsp.modelrecording=true' system prop
    - can add temporarily to bootRun task's jvmArgs
  - start application
  - access the GSPs by using the application (integration tests etc.)
  - the changes will get written directly to GSP files at shutdown
    - debug info is written to System.err
  - use vcs (git) to compare the changes.

Allow configuring GSP compileStatic explicitly

- setting compile static explicitly on is usable without changes for
  all GSPs since type checking extension will switch to dynamic calls
  when model is undefined
  - this might be more useful for testing purposes
- defining model fields switches compile static on for a specific GSP
  unless GSP compileStatic is explicitly swithed off.
  - it's possible to use model fields when compile static is off

Don't initialize the transaction manager until a bean is found that implements TransactionManagerAware. Fixes https://github.com/grails/gorm-hibernate5/issues/7

The TransactionManagerAwarePostProcessor was causing early initialization of all of GORM which meant GORM classes could not using @Autowired to process dependencies. This fixes that by only initiasing the transaction manager if a bean is found that implements TransactionManagerAware. This will be late enough in the process that by then the autowire bean post processor will have been registered.

Use a read/write lock in CacheEntry

The read lock should be acquired when getting or setting the value, but in getValue() and setValue(V val) there was no lock being acquired.

This lack of locking can result in race conditions. I discovered this issue by clearing the GroovyPagesTemplateEngine cache in an infinite loop, which caused page metaclasses to not be removed, resulting in a memory leak.

Reducing the number of classes defined to only 2 instead of 2 per page
Causing the pageCache to not hold a transitive reference to the Callable class, allowing it to be garbage collected

GRAILS-11601 -simplify some constraint related logic

This simplifies some logic around the code which decides which properties should be forced to be constrained at compile time.  The prior logic was discovering all setter methods and then only forcing the property to be constrained if a corresponding getter method was found.  This shortcuts that and just looks for getter methods.  The setter shouldn't be relevant when deciding if a property is constrainable.

This change is related to both GRAILS-11601 and GRAILS-9686.

This commit includes several significant changes that align Grails closer to Spring MVC and Spring Boot:

1) UrlMappingsFilter is now gone and instead represented by a UrlMappingsHandlerMapping and UrlMappingsInfoHandlerAdapter combination
2) With the filter gone all requests now go directly onto the GrailsDispatcherServlet
3) The custom GrailsDispatcherServlet and hideous SimpleGrailsControllerHelper classes are gone, their functionality being handled by the Spring MVC DispatcherServlet and the above mentioned handler mappings

The benefits of these changes is that Grails applications appear even more like a regular Spring application now with very few custom extensions added to the DispatcherServlet.

One remaining TODO item is to rewrite ErrorHandlingServlet for these changes.

GRAILS-11095 - improve controller exception handling testability

When unit testing a controller action which accepts a command object the built in exception handling support does not work from a unit test if the command object is explicitly passed to the action from the unit test (as opposed to the unit test populating request parameters and allowing the framework to create the command object). This change moves the exception handling from the AST transformation generated no-arg method to the original method defined in source code so the exception handling is in place when either method is invoked (the no-arg method invokes the generated method).

Clarify why 'input disabled' error occurs for user.

When Grails thinks that a new version of a plugin needs installing, it asks the
user whether to install that new version. This is fine when using the `grails`
command, but if the project is being built with Maven, it causes an exception.
Previously, this exception gave no indication what caused it.

This change incorporates the 'prompt' that caused the exception in the error
message, thus allowing users to determine how to fix it (perhaps by fixing
plugin versions in POMs or cleaning the target directory).

GRAILS-9928 - improve the handling of wrapper downloads

The old logic was something like this:

if downloadFile does not exist
    download to downloadFile
end if

if installDir does not exist
    extract downloadFile to installDir
end if

This was problematic if downloadFile exists and installDir does not exist and downloadFile is not a valid zip file.  This would happen if an earlier attempt was made to download to downloadFile but for some reason could not be completed.  That would lead to attempting to extract an invalid zip file.

The new logic is something like this:

if installDir does not exist
    download to downloadFile
    extract downloadFile to installDir
    delete downloadFile
end if

If the parsing error occurs during the automatic data binding that is imposed on command objects, the response status code is set to 400 and the controller action is never actually invoked. GRAILS-9674 - fix GrailsEnvironment

The AbstractEnvironment constructor is calling customizePropertySources.  Our GrailsEnvironment class was overriding this method with code that referred to grailsApplication, which will not be initialized in time because it is initialized in the GrailsEnvironment constructor, which of course is called after the parent class constructor completes.  This rearranges the code to try and address this.  We need to test this and verify that all of the environment support stuff still works with this change.

to do inserts in proper dependency order (inserts get reordered by Hibernate in certain
cases).

prevent duplicate prefix in table name

The default table name for domain classes provided by plugins may be prefixed with the plugin name.  If MyPlugin provides a Widget domain class, the default table name would be my_plugin_widget if the grails.gorm.table.prefix.enabled property is set to true.  This commit prevents duplicate prefixes so if MyPlugin provides a domain class named MyPluginPerson, the default table name would be my_plugin_person, not my_plugin_my_plugin_person.

gorm table namespace support

If a domain class is provided by a plugin the default table name will be prefixed with the plugin name.  This behavior is disabled by default and may be enabled by assigning true to the grails.gorm.table.prefix.enabled config property

Also cache negative uri cache lookups.

Serving views or resources which do not have a controller is pretty slow due to uri lookups on every request.
This fixes it by also caching uri looks which do not have a controller.

To avoid DOS attacks, the cache is also limited in size, and the size can
be controlled via the grails.urlmapping.cache.maxsize config property.

If a command object class is not marked with @Validateable we are issuing a relevant compiler warning.

New command object handling for Grails 2.1

As of Grails 2.1 command objects will no longer automatically be made validateable.  If a command object class is not marked with @Validateable then the controller action will still accept the command object and will still do data binding but .validate() will not be invoked.  A relevant compiler warning will be issued.

GRAILS-8343 - NoSuchMethodError at command object validation

When a controller action accepts a parameter that is of a type other than String, a primitive or a type wrapper Grails will treat the type as a command object class.  Command object classes are made validateable at compile time.  A problem occurs if the class that is being used as a command object class is not being compiled as part of the project.  For those cases, we can't compile in the validation support.  This commit identifies situations like that and throws a compilation error instead of letting that turn into a runtime NoSuchMethodError when we try to call .validate().  If the class is not part of the project but is marked with @Validateable, this problem does not occur since the .validate() method will already be there.

GRAILS-7979 - Improve Command Object Reloading

The constrainedProperties property that is added to validateable classes (like command object classes) is static. When the reloading agent reloads a class that property needs to be nulled out so that it will be re-initialized, in case the reload was initiated by changing constraints.  This commit adds a statement to the validateable classes static initializer to null that property out.  Grails runs the static initializer when classes are reloaded by the agent.

another fix for GRAILS-6608 and GRAILS-3783. Hibernate doesn't seem to support non-nullable many side for a List association without adding the item to the list first. GRAILS-5863 - manually issue redirects instead of using sendRedirect() to avoid committing the response at the time the redirect is issued.

To compensate for this, we augment the getRedirectedUrl() method of the mock response we use for testing to look at the status code and “Location” header in GrailsMockHttpServletResponse.

A side affect of this is that  we had to change both some internal Grails tests and the user testing infrastructure to use GrailsMockHttpServletResponse over Spring's MockHttpServletResponse so that redirects can be tested for (via response.redirectedUrl) as they have been up until now.

Grails would sometimes attempt to render the wrong view, particularly
during error dispatch. This was because certain information about the
view to render was stored in the request, and that was affecting whatever
was forwarded to. So while Grails would try to render the view associated
with an error action, suddenly it would end up rendering the original
one.

This fix clears certain request attributes before that request is
forwarded. This was already being done for includes, so I refactored
to share the code with the forwarding methods.

add support for customizing the GrailsWebApplicationContext

Currently, there is no way to customize creating and configuration of the GrailsWebApplicationContext. This patch allows to specifiy a context-param in web.xml for a different implementation of GrailsRuntimeConfigurator. 

In order to create a different GrailsWebApplicationContext, a configurator derived from GrailsRuntimeConfigurator may create a spring configuration derived from WebRuntimeSpringConfiguration, which in turns creates a different implementation of GrailsWebApplicationContext.

Use case: OSGi support (using Spring DM) requires that the ApplicationContext implements org.springframework.osgi.context.ConfigurableOsgiBundleApplicationContext, so a class which is derived from GrailsWebApplicationContext and implements ConfigurableOsgiBundleApplicationContext is necessary. The OSGi plugin will supply such a class, and this patch is required so it may be created and used by Grails.

Optimization for load times. Grails no longer creates instances of artefacts by default and everything is now lazily initialized. Grails will only create an instance of an artefact if a plugin requests a value of a property that is an instance property (non-static). This is needed for backwards compatibility, but now out of the box when you start Grails, Grails will no longer create multiple instances of tag libraries, services and so on.

Introduced “GrailsTestType” as the contract for test types to be run by the “test-app”.

Also added substantial support for test types via the “org.codehaus.groovy.grails.test.support” package.

The standard JUnit test stuff has been updated to be compatible with this new API.

This change is completely backwards compatible and imposes no change on users.

Introduced “GrailsTestEventPublisher”.

An instance of this class is passed to each test runner. Test runners are responsible for calling it's methods in the correct sequence.

This is really about facilitating IDE integration for running tests. IDEs can use the Grails “build listening” feature to inject a listener for these events and display suitable visual notification of test run results.
Refactored the test reporting stuff so it is more self contained and usable from other test runners.

GSP performance patch improvements

Major GSP performance patch . 1) Optimizes GSP -> groovy code generation (less generated Groovy code, more in the Java base class GroovyPage.).
Generates less bytecode -> reduces permgen memory usage. Some performance improvements.
2) Uses StreamCharBuffer for buffering taglib body closure's content and makes it possible to pass the body on to the "upper level"
without transforming the output to a java.lang.String in between. "out" reference lookup was improved. "out" is a single proxy to the correct Writer instance.
There is a stack for handling the "out" Writer replacement. "body()" in taglib returns a StreamCharBuffer instance instead of a java.lang.String. This might break some plugins.
3) Initial changes for adding support for request or session scoped taglibs. A scope property should be defined when the Taglib bean in created in the app context. This feature isn't active yet.
Session scoped taglibs could be used for shopping carts etc. The state can be kept directly in the taglib bean's properties.
4) Taglib can return any object value. Not just a java.lang.String.

Improved GSP<->Sitemesh integration that prevents parsing the html page. Config property "grails.views.gsp.sitemesh.preprocess = false" turns this off.

GRAILS-2741: Custom constraints provided by plugins are not available
when domain classes are initially processed (unless the plugin is loaded
before the domain class plugin), so the domain class constraints are
"refreshed" after all the plugins have loaded. The constraints of
embedded domain classes, though, weren't refreshed and so custom
constraints were not being triggered by the validation.

Now the DefaultGrailsDomainClass.refreshConstraints() method manually
refreshes the constraints of any component/embedded properties.
